TopicTitle: [1.12] HyperEdit [v1.5.8, July 10, 2018] - Cheat, Teleporter, Orbit/Planet Editor, & More

Articles.Content:
I've tested the latest version of HyperEdit with the recent update to KSP, and it works, but I didn't try everything. Hopefully, all is well. If not, please let me know.

Great news - thank you, will let ya know if I find anything, but I very much doubt I will with all your hard work
Nothing comes up for me :/

Nothing comes up for me :/

Have you tried turning it off and back on again?

The current version of HyperEdit, v1.2.4.2, works with KSP v0.22. I will also update our page to reflect this.

kinder, gentler...

Uh, is it just me, or is the website down? I quite need this mod because when I'm launching 400+ rockets, its killing my cpu and I can barely get it to orbit, and I'm not even talking about docking it to the spaceship I'm building at the orbit. Anyone has mirror of it?

Uh, is it just me, or is the website down? I quite need this mod because when I'm launching 400+ rockets, its killing my cpu and I can barely get it to orbit, and I'm not even talking about docking it to the spaceship I'm building at the orbit. Anyone has mirror of it?

Sorry, but it's just you. Our servers are in Utah, and it's working fine for me near the Kennedy Space Center in Florida.

If you continue to have problems, please PM me with the error message you're getting, and your public IP address so I can find you in the logs.

I can email you a copy of HyperEdit if you like.

Where version for 0.22+ ?
It should work in .22, as it doesn't require any parts to add into the tech tree (the tech tree being the main thing added in .22)
HyperEdit 1.2.4.2 works just fine for me in KSP 0.22.0.

Where version for 0.22+ ?

All downloads and information are always on our website.

Recent reports that our website is down, or having problems, are false.

As of October 29, 2013:

  • www.KerbaltekAerospace.com is fully functional, and has had exactly zero downtime since its inception in June of 2013.
  • The current version of HyperEdit works with KSP v0.22.
  • All downloads, information and support can always be found on our site.

I'm having problems with the website. I can only get to a cached version of the website's home page and I cannot download hyperedit. What should I do?

mike9606,

Were you ever able to view our site and/or get a copy of HyperEdit? I haven't heard back from you since your report, but I see that you visited the forum again today, so I'm hoping you've got what you need. If not, please let me know, and I'll make it happen.
VAC Bannable?

VAC Bannable?

I honestly don't know, but somehow I doubt it. Considering that KSP has no multiplayer component, I can't see why banning someone using HyperEdit would serve any purpose.

Why do you ask? EDIT: (sorry, stupid question)

EDIT: What did Valve say when you asked them?

All my research tells me, no - Kerbal Space Program is not VAC enabled, so there's no risk of being banned by using HyperEdit.

Here's Steam's offical Store Search page that confirms this:

http://store.steampowered.com/search/?sort_by=Name&sort_order=ASC&term=kerbal#term=kerbal&category2=8&sort_by=Name&sort_order=ASC&page=1

Also, the same thing can be seen in the Steam client by clicking "Store", search for "kerbal", click "Advanced search", then "Category", and choose "Valve Anti-Cheat enabled" - you will get zero results. This tells me that KSP is not a VAC enabled game.

However and as always, I could theoretically be wrong, so definitely check with Valve if you're still worried about getting banned.

Edited November 1, 2013 by vexx32
Merged posts.
Am I able to use this to teleport a craft to the surface of another planet?

Yeah it has landing ability. Deafult height is like 50m. This might not work for all planets or moons that you might want to land on.

Am I able to use this to teleport a craft to the surface of another planet?
I had seen that, but I didn't see where I could specify a different body - only co-ords for the current body. Did I miss something?

This mod is very useful Ezriic! I do not use it often but it is a great tool to have! Also, it is not just a "cheat tool". Some examples of how you would use this plugin in a less "cheaty" way include:

*Testing bugs *Putting things like the FASA asteroids into orbit *Putting your spaceship back into orbit after a crash

It is also fun just to change the orbits of planets sometimes!

This mod is very useful Ezriic! I do not use it often but it is a great tool to have! Also, it is not just a "cheat tool". Some examples of how you would use this plugin in a less "cheaty" way include:

*Testing bugs *Putting things like the FASA asteroids into orbit *Putting your spaceship back into orbit after a crash

It is also fun just to change the orbits of planets sometimes!

Yes!

You'd use the Orbit Editor to put yourself in orbit around the body you want, and then use Ship Lander to put it on the surface.

I had seen that, but I didn't see where I could specify a different body - only co-ords for the current body. Did I miss something?

Edit yourself to orbit of the body you want to land on, then set the hight.

I had seen that, but I didn't see where I could specify a different body - only co-ords for the current body. Did I miss something?

It sounds like you're skipping the Orbit Editor step.

This mod is very useful Ezriic! I do not use it often but it is a great tool to have! Also, it is not just a "cheat tool". Some examples of how you would use this plugin in a less "cheaty" way include:

*Testing bugs *Putting things like the FASA asteroids into orbit *Putting your spaceship back into orbit after a crash

It is also fun just to change the orbits of planets sometimes!

I'm glad you like it!

I also use it for launching water craft - the building of which I am the undisputed champion.
